docs.summary: Represents a Microsoft XML .NET configuration file.
docs.remarks:
.NET configuration section names are
element nodes they cannot contain certain characters such as whitespace.

docs.summary: Constructor. Loads an empty .NET config source.
docs.remarks: This constructor is useful if you want to create a .NET config source programmatically. You can then call one of the methods to save it to a file or object.

docs.summary: Creates a new instance of the XML configuration source.
docs.remarks: This instance type is not read only. It changes the value of the configuration file for the executable. For instance, if the name of the executable is "MyApp.exe" then it will load the data from the "MyApp.exe.config" file.

docs.summary: Creates a new instance of the XML configuration source.
docs.remarks:
Instantiating this way does not currently allow for saving configuration changes because the will be null. Use this for configuration ASP.NET web sites that use the Web.config file.
This method is not supported by the .NET Compact Framework.
docs.param: Array of sections contained in the XML file. These cannout be determined programmatically so you will have to supply them at load time.

docs.summary: Creates a new instance of the XML configuration source.
docs.remarks:
Use this if you either know where the configuration file is located. You can do this with the
Page.MapPath method for web.config files.

docs.summary: Creates a new instance of the XML configuration source.
The path where the document will be saved.
docs.remarks: This path is set when the class is loaded with a path or saved with a path (using the Save (string) method). Otherwise the value will be null. If it is null then calling save will cause an exception to be thrown.

docs.summary: Loads a new instance of the XML configuration source.
docs.remarks: This instance type is not read only. It changes the value of the configuration file for the executable. For instance, if the name of the executable is "MyApp.exe" then it will load the data from the "MyApp.exe.config" file.

docs.summary: Loads a new instance of the XML configuration source.
docs.remarks:
Use this if you either know where the configuration file is located. You can do this with the
Page.MapPath method for web.config files.

docs.summary: Loads a new instance of the XML configuration source.

docs.remarks: If the is null then this will throw an exception.

docs.summary: Saves all configuration values to a path.
Saves all configuration values to a TextWriter.
docs.param: The TextWriter to save the document.

docs.summary: Writes the XML data to a Stream.
Returns the full path to the configuration file
docs.remarks:
This is a file with the extension of the application: MyApp.exe would be C:\Path_To_Program\MyApp.exe.config.
This method is not supported by the .NET Compact Framework.

docs.summary: Returns all characters in the document.
docs.remarks: It returns the XML string of the document.
